instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state sometimes powers on
threads.message:
This board came a while ago, someone else had tried to repair it and they messed with the SMC and somehow the CPU did not have the black decal on top, we fixed it by repairing a bad trace on <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> and replacing <CHIP>U8005</CHIP>, board worked great for about 3-4 months.

It is back now as it is shutting down randomly, while here we have check the area we worked on and looks fine, board sometimes starts but after about 3-5 minutes it shuts down and tried to start up again, but eventually it stops and hangs around S0 state. If I leave it alone for a while I can come back and use it for about 3-5 minutes...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state sometimes powers on
threads.message:
"someone else had tried to repair it and they messed with the SMC "
Did you reball SMC?
Maybe need to change it.

Try to see what happens if start in SMC bypass mode.
